AStar

public AStar(WorldMap map,
             int maxSearchDistance,
             boolean allowDiagMovement)
Create a path finder with the default heuristic

Parameters:
map - The tile map to be searched
maxSearchDistance - The maximum depth we'll search before giving up
allowDiagMovement - True if the search should try diaganol movement

AStar

public AStar(WorldMap map,
             int maxSearchDistance,
             boolean allowDiagMovement,
             Heuristics heuristic)
Create a path finder

Parameters:
heuristic - The heuristic used to determine the search order of the map
map - The tile map to be searched
maxSearchDistance - The maximum depth we'll search before giving up
allowDiagMovement - True if the search should try diaganol movement
Method Detail

findPath

public Path findPath(Robot robot,
                     int sx,
                     int sy,
                     int tx,
                     int ty)
Description copied from interface: PathFinder
Finds a path from (sx, sy) to (dx, dy) on a tile map taking into account the obstacles defined and also the cost of moving from one tile to the other

Specified by:
findPath in interface PathFinder
Parameters:
robot - The unit that we want to move along the path
sx - The x coordinate of the origin of the path
sy - The y coordinate of the origin of the path
tx - The x coordinate of the destination of the path
ty - The y coordinate of the destination of the path
Returns:
The path from (sx, sy) to (dx, dy) or Null if no path was found
See Also:
PathFinder#findPath(Mover, int, int, int, int)

getMovementCost

public float getMovementCost(Robot robot,
                             int sx,
                             int sy,
                             int tx,
                             int ty)
Get the cost to move through a given location

Parameters:
mover - The entity that is being moved
sx - The x coordinate of the tile whose cost is being determined
sy - The y coordinate of the tile whose cost is being determined
tx - The x coordinate of the target location
ty - The y coordinate of the target location
Returns:
The cost of movement through the given tile

getHeuristicCost

public float getHeuristicCost(Robot robot,
                              int x,
                              int y,
                              int tx,
                              int ty)
Get the heuristic cost for the given location. This determines in which order the locations are processed.

Parameters:
mover - The entity that is being moved
x - The x coordinate of the tile whose cost is being determined
y - The y coordinate of the tile whose cost is being determined
tx - The x coordinate of the target location
ty - The y coordinate of the target location
Returns:
The heuristic cost assigned to the tile
